body_html:
In #391 we're creating a set of test API responses; this issue covers taking those responses and making a test service that Firefox QA can use in testing the system add-on out.

@mythmon and I talked about this at Hawaii and came up with an idea that could work: create a script that takes the pre-written test responses, signs them using the development autograph service, and upload the signed contents to S3. If we have sub-directories for each different test case, QA can just update the pref pointing to the Normandy server and restart Firefox, and they'll receive new recipes for the test case and execute them.

We'll want to document how to use the script to update the test service, and document for QA how to use the test service (e.g. how to change Firefox to trust the dev autograph's signatures, or how to clear out the flags to track if a heartbeat recipe has executed so that they can be run again).
title: System add-on test service
